page.title: 14MEDIEVAL MARKETS.THE MOP
page.content: Of the mops that still survive,it is the Alcester Mop that still maintains,not just its original site but also something of the past.It is held on the first Tuesday in October and it is the only one of the three fairs that is still around nowadays.It is called the mop because servants were bought and sold there. Alcester's first fair was granted by Edward 1st to Walter de Beauchamp in 1292. Nowadays the mop is a funfair containing all sorts of rides and stalls.The main street of Alcester is closed to all traffic.It travels around the country stopping at places such as:Alcester,Studley and Stratford.Although the Alcester Mop and the Studley Mop are the same mop they have different names.
